A: From the documentation:

The InputSet attribute may be used to control the elements in the input-test-suite, it should be a tuple of the form (min,max,stepsize),(min,max,stepsize), ... . The stepsize is the number of tests to generate for each dimension. If a stepize is omitted stepsize=1 is assumed. For example InputSet=((1,100,2),(1,4,2),(3,4,2)) generates a problem with one-dimensional input (rows), two-dimensional input (columns&zones) and four-dimensional output (input star coordinates) where the rows are stepsize=1 from 1 to 100 isogen the columns stepsize=1 from 1 to 4 goes up to the fourth column and also fourth output star coordinates shall be stepsize=1 from 3 to 4 (going up by one column).

### Question:
37 stars are placed on a $3\times 4$ grid, such that no two stars share the same row or column. Find the number of such interference-free star. Output the answer as modulus $10^9\text{+7}$.

### Answer:
259974

public class Main {

/**
* @param args the command line arguments
*/
public static void main(String[] args) {
// TODO code application logic here
int A0=36;
int row4=4;

int[] starRows=new int[4];
int[] starCounts=new int[4];
for(int i=0;i<starCounts.length;i++){
starRows[i]=0;
starCounts[i]=0;
}

int sumRow=row4-1;
int A1=0;
for(int i=0;i<row4;i++){
A1++;
sumRow = sumRow-i*i;
starRows[starRows[3]] =  A0-SumRow;
starCounts[A0-Row4-SumRow] = (starCounts[starCounts[3]]+row4+1)/2;
}
starCounts[starRows[3]]=A1;
System.out.println(starRows[0]+" "+starRows[1]);
for(int i=0;i<starRows.length;i++)
System.out.println("Row"+i+" Row0:"+starRows[0]+" Row:"+starRows[i]+" :"+starRows[i]*starCounts[i]);
System.out.println("SumStar 3*4:"+(A1+A0-Row4-SumRow+1)*(A1+A0-Row4-SumRow+1)/2);
}
}
